column4: is there a way to create an alias to /etc/init.d/ so thath if i write restart <param> it would recognize im taking about /etc/init.d/<param> restart ?
are you coming from a Red Hat/Fedora background? Isn't that how it works in Fedora. service [servicename] restart? You can always create your own script called restart and write it yourself.
very simple, it only needs the line (besides standard header) /etc/init.d/$1 restart
